messages.title: THE CHOICE ON THURSDAY, 6 MAY
messages.content: Steve was formerly a Royal Air Force engineer officer and a consulting software engineer. He lives in High Wycombe with his wife, Beth, a general practitioner. If elected, he will commute to Parliament daily at his own expense, putting your concerns first. Steve's top priority is improving our local health services.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Steve Baker backs the NHS and will work to improve maternity and A&E. He wants accountable and transparent health services centred on patients, not political targets, with clinical staff free and in control.

Steve Baker knows the family is the fundamental building block of society. He insists every parent should be able to do what is best for their child. Steve believes every family mattersâ€”whatever their background.

Steve Baker wants to abolish grammar schools and wants to support and enhance the upper schools to give a great education to every child. Steve backs measures to raise standards, restore discipline and enhance the status of teachers. He backs plans to break down barriers to new schools.

Steve Baker wants fewer politicians with less power. He would use the abolition regional government, to get power back from the EU and to restore democratic control over governance. He agrees that Parliament should be smaller and less expensive.

issues.brexitEurope: He would use the abolition of regional government, to get power back from the EU.
